sentences.sContent: She picked up the letter and read it.
Read the instructions carefully before you start.
sentences.sCn: 开始前要仔细阅读说明。

sentences.sContent: children who are just learning to read and write
sentences.sCn: 刚刚开始学习读和写的儿童

sentences.sContent: Her books are quite widely read (= read by a lot of people ) .
When I was young, I read every one of his books from cover to cover (= read all of something because you are very interested ) .
sentences.sCn: 我小时候，他的每一本书我都从头到尾一页不落地看过。

sentences.sContent: ... Admissions officers read every personal statement that arrives...
...The results also showed that middle school students read more books than high schoolers...
...Over 66% of teens like to read fiction...
...Over half the teenagers interviewed said they read more than ten books a year...
...it will die off with the generation who read print newspapers...
...The closest that Herpin came to resting was to sit in a rocking chair and read a half dozen newspapers...
...And although you don't read about this much...
...I just sit in comfort and read the papers to catch up with the news...
...read a whole paragraph before you mark anything...
...They don't have time to read a chapter three or four times...

phrases.pCn: 体会言外之意，领悟言外之意
曲解；加上另外的意思于；隐藏某种意义
再读一遍；仔细阅读（等于read through）

words.tran: 可读的；易读的；读起来津津有味的
读者人数；读者们；读者的身分

trans.tranOther: to look at written words and understand what they mean
